translated_text: Today in History On May 11, 1939, the Battle of Nomonkan between Japan and the Soviet Union broke out Wen Shigong said: It was a "Manchurian" Mongolian border war that broke out in Nomonhan, the border between Manchuria and Outer Mongolia at that time. It was the first head-to-head encounter between the Soviet Union and Japan. It was Japan's temptation against the Soviet Union. The Soviet Union was of course desperately defending, and both sides suffered heavy casualties. Japan knows that the Soviet Union is not easy to eat; the Soviet Union does not want to start a battle with Japan. Finally, the two sides truce.
